description: Yemen, the poorest country in the Middle East, is embroiled in a struggle for power that has serious implications for the region and the security of the United States.
title: The Crisis in Yemen: What You Need to Know
title_page: The Crisis in Yemen: What You Need to Know - The New York Times
text:
After a nearly month-long bombing campaign in Yemen by a Saudi-led coalition of 10 Arab countries, the Saudi government announced Tuesday that it would halt its attacks. It is unclear if the decision will lead to peace talks between the antagonists in Yemen, the regionâ€™s poorest country, where the mounting crisis has drawn regional powers Egypt, Iran and Saudi Arabia deeper into a violent struggle for influence.
Here is a look at the crucial divisions and the parties to the conflict.
